In North America he's creating consensus on Chrysler before its initial public offering, while in Italy he needs to shock the country into creating a more competitive environment. Fiat's 22,000 auto workers in Italy assembled 650,000 cars in 2009, compared with 600,000 made by 6,100 employees at the company's factory in Tychy, Poland. a management restructure involving long-time chief executive Eric Schmidt becoming executive chairman. Eric Schmidt , who has led Google since 2001, will take on the new role on April 4, working mostly on external operations, including deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships, government outreach and technology thought leadership.
